intro: Dissanthelium macusaniense, commonly known as the Andes hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is a member of the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with pale green to brown flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous regions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
